bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, May 21, 1940

div1.p: Clemons acknowledges return of "Walter Reed and Yellow Fever." He offers to forward a copy of the Moran - Kean correspondence if necessary.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, May 21, 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
21 May 1940
THE NEW YORK ACADEMY OF MEDICINE
COMMITTEE ON MEDICAL EDUCATION
2 East 103 Street
NEW YORK
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
The copy of Dr. Howard A.
Kelly's ‘Walter Reed and Yellow Fever’ has re-
turned safely. As you were not certain, when
your letter of May fifteenth was written, whether
you would receive from General Kean a copy of the
Kean-Moran correspondence, we are not forwarding
to you our photoprint copy until we have further
directions from you.

We shall look forward to seeing you on
your visit to Virginia.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Avenue, S. W.
Rochester, Minnesota
